Smooth Criminal (from Glee) ã€covered by Anna ft. @CalebHyles ã€‘
description:
Hello everyone! This week I sang Smooth Criminal from Glee (but also most definitely sang by Michael Jackson) with @CalebHyles!

Glee had some wicked bangers, Iâ€™m sure we can all agree on that. This is FOR SURE one of them. I had this bad boy on my car playlist for a loooong time and Iâ€™m glad I actually had the opportunity to sing it. But seeing that my name is Anna I feel a personal responsibility to answer the ever present question;

Ann(ie)a, are you okay? 
Iâ€™m pretty good, thank you for asking.

As always, thank you for your continued support! It really does mean the world to me. Hope you all have a fantastic evening and Iâ€™ll see you next Saturday.
â™¥
(you can listen to this bad boy on the go too: https://bit.ly/SmoothCriminalAnna)

title: Glee: A Brief Analysis
description:
I have a few thoughts about Glee...
Perhaps the real Glee Project was the 12 hour deep-dive/retrospective we made along the way.
00:00 Intro
02:00 Chapter 1: What is Glee?
04:10 Chapter 2: Immaculate Conception
05:34 Chapter 3: The Cast List
09:51 Chapter 4: The Pilot
22:24 Chapter 5: Season 1
01:10:17 Chapter 6: Season 2
02:18:11 Chapter 7: The Glee Concert
02:34:41 Chapter 8: The Glee Project (season one)
03:29:43 Chapter 9: Season 3
04:27:38 Chapter 10: A Cancelled Spin-off
04:29:34 Chapter 11: The Glee Project (season two)
05:00:30 Chapter 12: The New New directions.
05:03:56 Chapter 13: Season 4
05:48:34 SENSITIVE CONTENT SKIP TO HERE
05:59:55 Chapter 14: Season 5a
06:33:54 Chapter 15: Season 5b
06:49:06 Chapter 16: Season 6
07:10:54 Chapter 17: Where are the character now?
07:13:53 Chapter 18: The Songs
07:55:42 Chapter 19: The Fashion
08:09:57 Chapter 20: The Cameos
08:29:08 Chapter 21: The Villains
09:05:50 Chapter 22: The Dating Tree
09:18:53 Chapter 23: Problematic Stuff (in the narrative)
09:31:40 Chapter 24: The Trial of William Schuester
10:05:24 Chapter 25: Stuff they got Wrong!
10:31:35 Chapter 26: A Glee Mystery
10:44:22 Chapter 27: Where are actors now?
10:56:04 Chapter 28: The Glee "Curse"
11:04:03 Chapter 29: Problematic Stuff (in real life)
11:18:41 Chapter 30: Representation







Written & Edited by @AnnasEraOfficial 
Filmed & Edited by @TheWritersBlockOfficial

description: In a touching appearance on the podcast And Thatâ€™s What You REALLY Missed, Dianna Agron opened her heart when reflecting on her late Glee co-starsâ€”Cory Monteith, Naya Rivera, and Mark Salling. She described how they "feel so present" in every part of her beingâ€”heart, body, mind, and soul. She also fondly remembered Cory Monteithâ€™s warmth, saying "there was not an ungenerous bone in his body," and shared a sweet recollection of him gifting her brother sunglasses from his collection #DiannaAgron #Glee #CoryMonteith #NayaRivera #MarkSalling #Friendship #Memory #Podcast #GLEEreunion #EmotionalTribute #CelebrityNews #ViralNews #MustListen #AndThatsWhatYouReallyMissed

title: Dianna Agron Remembers Cory Monteith: The Heart of Gleeâ€™s Family
description:
Welcome! Today, we take a heartfelt journey into the life of Glee star Cory Monteith, as remembered by his co-star Dianna Agron. Cory wasnâ€™t just a talented actor and singerâ€”he was a kind, generous, and caring presence on and off set. Dianna shared on a podcast that Cory had â€œnot an ungenerous bone in his bodyâ€ and described him as a true leader who made everyone around him feel valued and supported.

She shared a touching story: at a pool party, her brother squinted in the sun, and Cory noticed immediately. Without hesitation, he gave him a pair of sunglasses from his own collection, insisting he keep them. This small act perfectly captured Coryâ€™s thoughtful and selfless nature.

Dianna reflected on how Cory created a warm, family-like atmosphere on set, alongside other cast members like Naya Rivera and Mark Salling. She emphasized that while individual scenes from the show may fade from memory, the personal connections and shared moments remain vivid and unforgettable.

Through stories like these, we remember Cory Monteith not just as a performer but as a remarkable human being whose kindness, humor, and generosity touched everyone around him. These memories keep his spirit alive, inspiring us to celebrate his life and the joy he brought to so many.

If you enjoyed this tribute to Cory, donâ€™t forget to subscribe, share your thoughts in the comments, and help us continue bringing heartfelt stories from your favorite stars to life.

EVERYTHING You NEED To Know About GLEEâ€™S Crimes & Controversies (& Curse?)
description:
Glee was a popular culture phenomenon when it launched on Fox in 2009. Created by Ryan Murphy the show starred Diana Agron, Chris Colfer, Cory Monteith, Lea Michele, Amber Riley, Kevin McHale, Jenna Ushkowitz, Mark Salling, Chord Overstreet, Harry Shun Jr, Heather Morris, Naya Rivera & Darren Criss. Glee was extremely popular and its cast were globally famous in the first few seasons, but today, Glee is just as infamous for its behind the scenes controversies, crimes and tragedies. Two of Gleeâ€™s most celebrated cast members have lost their lives in tragic ways, several main cast members have been wrapped up in dark and deplorable behaviour, a string of accusations have also been levied at one of the shows biggest stars. So in this video we're discussing the behind the scenes issues on Glee, the poor on set behaviour of certain members of the cast, how some fans went too far with their love of the show, the cast members who tragically lost their lives and the criminal behaviour of cast members who preyed on and hurt others. (TIMESTAMPS BELOW)

Due to the Glee deaths, tragedies, controversies, crimes & other deplorable behaviour, many people claim that Glee is cursed... So today we'll be discussing everything that happened on and off the Glee set, and behind the scenes. Let me know your thoughts in the comments below. As always, my sources are in the pinned comment & linked here https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lcSx7PnnRWyS-NprSz3dpWm9Zs-T-wLCmByNb4JwhbA/edit?usp=sharing

title: Glee- Total Eclipse of the Heart
description:
This is my favorite moment in Glee. Jonathan Groff has an amazing voice! 

From Glee Season 1 Episode 17- Bad Reputation

 Rachel plays them a video of her performing "Run Joey Run" with Puck, Finn and Jesse. All three guys seem disgusted by the video as none were told of the other two's involvement. They all realize she used her and storm out.

Jesse confronts Rachel about her lying to him. He can't get past her dishonesty and breaks up with her, saying she broke his heart first.

The whole group ends with Bonnie Tyler's "Total Eclipse of the Heart," during which we see the pain of Rachel and Jesse's break-up.

title: Glee Actors Who Died Tragically â€” The Dark Side of Fame
description:
Glee was one of the most beloved musical TV shows of its generation. With a vibrant young cast and bold storylines, it inspired millions across the world. But behind the uplifting music and energetic performances lies a series of heartbreaking real-life tragedies that shook the Glee community forever.

In this video, we remember the lives of three Glee cast members who tragically passed away at a young age. Their stories are more than headlines â€” theyâ€™re real, painful, and deeply emotional. Letâ€™s take a closer look at the stars we lost too soon.

ðŸ•Šï¸ Cory Monteith (1982â€“2013)  
Cory played Finn Hudson â€” the show's kind-hearted football player turned singer. He was one of the emotional pillars of Glee, both on and off screen. But behind his charm, Cory struggled for years with addiction. Despite efforts to recover, Cory sadly passed away from a heroin and alcohol overdose in a Vancouver hotel room at just 31 years old. His sudden death devastated fans worldwide and marked the beginning of what some called the â€œGlee Curse.â€

ðŸ•Šï¸ Naya Rivera (1987â€“2020)  
Naya portrayed Santana Lopez â€” a fan-favorite character who became an LGBTQ+ icon thanks to her complex, emotional storyline. Off-screen, Naya was a devoted mother, talented performer, and fierce individual. In 2020, Naya went missing during a boat trip with her son at Lake Piru, California. After days of intense search efforts, her body was found on July 13 â€” the same day Cory died seven years earlier. She was only 33. Her final act was heroic: she saved her son, sacrificing herself.

ðŸ•Šï¸ Mark Salling (1982â€“2018)  
Mark played Noah â€œPuckâ€ Puckerman â€” the show's resident bad boy with a hidden heart. Although he brought depth and humor to Glee, Mark's personal life took a dark turn. He was arrested in 2015 and later pleaded guilty to serious charges. Before sentencing, Mark died by suicide at the age of 35. His death remains controversial and painful, reflecting the complexity of fame, mental health, and accountability.

ðŸŒ‘ The Glee Curse?  
With three major cast members dying within a few years â€” all under tragic or scandalous circumstances â€” some fans and media began to refer to a â€œGlee Curse.â€ While not everyone believes in such ideas, the emotional weight of these losses is undeniable. Whether itâ€™s coincidence or something deeper, the grief remains very real for fans and the cast alike.

ðŸŒŸ Legacy Lives On  
Despite the tragedy, the impact these actors made continues. Glee helped break barriers and gave young people representation theyâ€™d never seen before. Today, fans still watch, rewatch, and share clips, music, and memories. The showâ€™s message â€” of embracing who you are and finding family in the unlikeliest places â€” continues to resonate.

ðŸ™ If you were touched by these stories, help keep their memories alive:  
ðŸ‘ Like this video  
ðŸ’¬ Share your favorite Glee moment in the comments  
ðŸ”” Subscribe for more videos about real stories behind the screen

Gone but never forgotten.  
Rest in peace, Cory, Naya, and Mark.

Languages: Portuguese and English.

This channel is Brazilian, and has translation into five languages â€“ Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, French and English. Titles, descriptions and subtitles are usually designed in English or Portuguese and translated by Google into other languages.

Almost all of the channel's videos have subtitles produced exclusively for this channel, that can be translated to any language automatically using the tools provided by Youtube.

What you can find on this channel:

Extended Versions of Glee Performances â€“ Watch your favorite performances with the studio version of the song. These videos feature extensive pre-planning, and some of them feature exclusive deleted scenes, taken from behind-the-scenes videos or other outside sources little known to fans.

Behind The Scenes â€“ See exclusive behind-the-scenes footage from the show, released on DVD/Blu-Ray or on television.

Mashups â€“ You can find the original songs mixed with the Glee version.

Maximum Quality Audio and Video â€“ All the series files used in this channel have the maximum quality of Blu-Ray.

Remastered in 4K â€“ Only here you can find videos remastered in 4K ULTRA HD by Artificial Intelligence. They go through a long process that increases detail and sharpness, as well as color and brightness correction. The result is spectacular. Some go through the Frame Interpolation process for smoother (60FPS).

You find a penguin, hopeless and aloneâ€¦ so you take it home. Sounds insane? Well, in Japan this really happened. Back in the 1990s, a rescued king penguin named Lala became famous for living like a human â€” sleeping in an air-conditioned room and even walking to the fish market with a backpack to buy his own food.

title: The LAZIEST Animal on Earthâ€¦ But Also the Smartest?
description:
When you think of the laziest animal on Earth, you probably picture lions sleeping all day or pandas chewing bamboo. But thereâ€™s one animal that takes laziness to the next level â€” the sloth. These creatures move so slowly that algae grows on their fur, and they only poop once a week. Sounds ridiculous, right? But hereâ€™s the twistâ€¦ their laziness is actually their survival strategy. By moving so little, they become almost invisible to predators, and believe it or not, they can even hold their breath longer than dolphins.

title: Who is the Most GLEE-VIL Character in Glee Season 2?
description:
How good season one of Glee is was one of the greatest surprises I've ever had while watching an older TV series. Assigning gloints to each character based on how gl-ood or, more likely, how glee-vil their actions are was a fun way to analyze the series. Season 2 of Glee attempts to build on the first season's success by revisiting the New Directions, Will Schuster, and Sue Sylvester while also adding a bunch of new faces to the show's growing roster of gleeks and losers. We hope you enjoy this video as a continuation of the Glee-watch series!

title: Season 3 of Glee Broke Me.
description:
Websterâ€™s dictionary defines season 3 of Glee as one of the shows of all time. After the massive success of season 1 and the continued interest of the second season, showrunners and co-creators Ryan Murphy, Ian Brennan, and Brad Falchuk were tasked with maintaining the relative success of their dramedy sitcom set in Lima, Ohio. 

This season sees the show take on storylines such as LGBGT acceptance and rejection, a student attempting to take their own life, DA and its harsh realities, and even Will Schuester admitting that he, as a Spanish teacher, never actually knew how to speak Spanish.

We hope you enjoy this gl-eep dive into the third season of Glee!

title: Glee - Get It Right (lyrics)
description:
He didn't die. He took the midnight train going anywhere... - Cory Monteith (1982 - 2013)

DISCLAIMER: I DO NOT OWN THE SONG OR THE PICTURES! ALL RIGHTS GO TO THE RESPECTIVE OWNERS!

Glee - Get It Right
Sung by: Lea Michele (Rachel Berry).
Episode: Original Song (2x16).
Track 15 from the Glee cd: Glee: The Music Vol. 5.
The original version is sung by the Glee Cast.

Lyrics:
What have I done?
I wish I could run, away from this ship going under
Just trying to help, hurt everyone else
Now I feel the weight of the world is on my shoulders
 
What can you do when your good isn't good enough and all that you touch tumbles down?
Cause my best intentions keep making a mess of things, I just wanna fix it somehow
But how many times will it take?
Oh, how many times will it take for me to get it right, to get it right?
 
Can I start again with my faith shaken?
Cause I can't go back and undo this
I just have to stay and face my mistakes, but if I get stronger and wiser I'll get through this
 
What can you do when your good isn't good enough and all that you touch tumbles down?
Cause my best intentions keep making a mess of things, I just wanna fix it somehow
But how many times will it take?
Oh, how many times will it take for me to get it right?
 
So I throw up my fist, throw a punch in the air and accept the truth that sometimes life isn't fair
Yeah, I'll send out a wish, yeah, I'll send up a prayer and finally someone will see how much I care
 
What can you do when your good isn't good enough and all that you touch tumbles down?
Cause my best intentions keep making a mess of things, I just wanna fix it somehow
But how many times will it take?
Oh, how many times will it take, to get it right, to get it right?

Track 11 from the Glee cd: Glee: The Music Presents The Warblers.

I knew the pathway like the back of my hand
I felt the earth beneath my feet

I'm getting old and I need something to rely on
So tell me when you're gonna let me in
I'm getting tired and I need somewhere to begin
 
I came across a fallen tree
I felt the branches of it looking at me
Is this the place we used to love?
Is this the place that I've been dreaming of?
 
Oh simple thing, where have you gone?
I'm getting old and I need something to rely on
So tell me when you're gonna let me in
I'm getting tired and I need somewhere to begin

This could be the end of everything
So why don't we go somewhere only we know?
Somewhere only we know

Talk about it somewhere only we know?
This could be the end of everything
So why don't we go? So why don't we go?
 
And if you have a minute, why don't we go
Talk about it somewhere only we know?
This could be the end of everything
So why don't we go somewhere only we know?
Somewhere only we know

All my people in the crowd, let me see you dance
C'mon Brittany take it down, make the music dance
All my people round and round, party all night long
C'mon Brittany lose control, watch you take it down.

(laugh)

title: Top 5 Glee Actors In Comic Book Roles
description:
From McKinley High to superhero heights! Join us as we explore talented performers from the hit musical series who made their mark in the world of comics adaptations. Our spotlight features stars who traded show choir for superpowers, bringing their theatrical skills to iconic characters in major franchises. Our countdown includes Melissa Benoist as Supergirl, Grant Gustin as The Flash, Naya Rivera's comic connections, Darren Criss in superhero projects, Jeff Goldblum in Marvel films, and more! Which crossover surprised you most? Let us know in the comments below!

#Glee #Supergirl #Flash #Comics #Superhero #DC #Marvel #Television #Entertainment #CW #Actors #Casting

title: Glee | What the Cast Is Up to Now
description:
From high school hallways to Hollywood heights! Join us as we catch up with the talented stars who once graced the McKinley High choir room. Discover how these former Gleeks have evolved their careers, from Broadway triumphs and Emmy wins to bestselling books and chart-topping music. Whether they're dancing, singing, acting, or producing, the New Directions alumni continue to shine in the spotlight! We're checking in with Chris Colfer, Jane Lynch, Lea Michele, Matthew Morrison, Jenna Ushkowitz, Darren Criss, Amber Riley, Chord Overstreet, Heather Morris, and Harry Shum Jr. to see what exciting projects they've tackled since their days of slushie facials and show choir competitions. Which former Glee star's career path surprised you most?

GLEE The Complete Series on DVD (Review) + The Concert Movie (Lea Michele)
description:
Hey guys in this video Iâ€™m reviewing one of my favorite musical TV Shows of all time â€œGLEEâ€ on DVD (The Complete Series) + my 3D Concert copy on Blu Ray. Glee (stylized as glee) is an American musical comedy-drama television series that aired on the Fox network in the United States from May 19, 2009, to March 20, 2015. It centers on the glee club called the New Directions at the fictional William McKinley High School which competes as a show choir while its disparate members deal with social issues, especially regarding sexuality, race, family, teen relationships and teamwork. The initial twelve-member cast included Matthew Morrison as club director and Spanish teacher Will Schuester, Jane Lynch as scheming cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester, Jayma Mays as guidance counselor Emma Pillsbury, Jessalyn Gilsig as Will's wife Terri, and the eight original club members, including Dianna Agron as Quinn Fabray, a popular cheerleader whose biggest struggle is her teenage pregnancy; Chris Colfer as Kurt Hummel, a gay boy who feels conflicted by his sexuality and is bullied at school; Kevin McHale as Artie Abrams, who lives with a physical disability; Lea Michele as Rachel Berry, driven by her dreams of becoming a Broadway theatre star and the glee club's most obvious star singer; Cory Monteith as Finn Hudson, the school's star quarterback who sometimes appears not to be very smart; Amber Riley as Mercedes Jones, an African American girl who endeavors to be recognized for her talents and dreams of being a vocal diva; Mark Salling as Noah Puckerman, a teenage delinquent in need of direction; and Jenna Ushkowitz as Tina Cohen-Chang, a shy girl of Korean descent who longs to be popular and sometimes experiences racism. The main cast was altered throughout the series, including the addition of Naya Rivera as Santana Lopez, an unapologetically Afro-Latina cheerleader experiencing deep conflict over her sexuality, Harry Shum Jr. as Mike Chang, a dancer with Chinese roots whose parents do not support his dreams, and Heather Morris as Brittany Pierce, a ditzy cheerleader who is secretly a math prodigy and comes to realize she is bisexual.

title: GLEE Season 1 DVD (Review) (Lea Michele)
description:
Hey guys in this video Iâ€™m reviewing one of my favorite musical TV Shows of all time â€œGLEEâ€ The Complete First Season on DVD. The first season of the musical comedy-drama television series Glee originally aired on Fox in the United States. The pilot episode was broadcast as an advanced preview of the series on May 19, 2009, with the remainder of the season airing between September 9, 2009, and June 8, 2010. The season consisted of 22 episodes; the first 13 aired on Wednesdays at 9 pm (ET) and the final 9 aired on Tuesdays at 9 pm (ET). The season was executive produced by Ryan Murphy, Brad Falchuk, and Dante Di Loreto; Murphy's production company helped co-produce the series alongside 20th Century Fox. The season features the fictional high school show choir New Directions competing for the first time on the show choir circuit, while its members and faculty deal with sex, bullying, body image, homosexuality, teenage pregnancy, disabilities, adoption and other social issues. The central characters are glee club director Will Schuester (Matthew Morrison), cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester (Jane Lynch), Will's former wife Terri (Jessalyn Gilsig), guidance counselor Emma Pillsbury (Jayma Mays), and glee club members Rachel (Lea Michele), Finn (Cory Monteith), Artie (Kevin McHale), Kurt (Chris Colfer), Mercedes (Amber Riley), Tina (Jenna Ushkowitz), Puck (Mark Salling), and Quinn (Dianna Agron). The season received generally positive reviews from critics. The musical scores used throughout the first season proved to be a commercial success, with over seven million copies of Glee cast single releases purchased digitally. In 2009, the Glee remake of "Don't Stop Believin'" became their first hit, and other covers quickly gained similar worldwide popularity, while the albums topped the charts in Ireland and other countries. The season was nominated for 19 Emmy Awards, four Golden Globe Awards, six Satellite Awards and 57 other awards. It was accompanied by four DVD releases: Glee â€“ Pilot Episode: Director's Cut, Glee â€“ Season 1, Volume 1: Road to Sectionals featuring episodes one to thirteen, Glee â€“ Season 1, Volume 2: Road to Regionals featuring episodes fourteen to twenty-two, and Glee â€“ The Complete First Season.

You can get the show on Amazon.com

Episode 281 welcomes Little Glee Monster, a six-member female vocal group that welcomes new members after auditioning in 2022.
1 TAKE performance of their representative song â€˜Sekai wa anatani waraikaketeiruâ€™ (The world is smiling on you), their staple at their concerts which was used as the CF song for Coca-Cola in Japan in 2018.
This time coming back to THE FIRST TAKE, Mika, Yumi, and miyou, who were chosen from among 7,002 contestants in the â€œMâˆžNSTER AUDITION,â€ joined the group to perform the song with the new six-member lineup.

title: Dianna Agron Reacts to â€˜Gleeâ€™ Fan Favorite Quinn and Rachel Ship
description:
Dianna Agron Reacts to â€˜Gleeâ€™ Fan Favorite Quinn and Rachel Ship


In a truly nostalgic and fan-centric moment, actress Dianna Agron, beloved for her iconic portrayal of Quinn Fabray on the hit musical series Glee, offered a surprising and lighthearted reaction to one of the showâ€™s most enduring fan-favorite pairings. The viral video captures Agron being asked about the 'Quinnchel' or 'Faberry' shipâ€”the popular fan theory that her character, Quinn, and Lea Micheleâ€™s character, Rachel Berry, should have ended up together. Her response, a simple yet hilarious rhetorical question, â€œWhat about Jesse?â€ immediately sent ripples of excitement and amusement through the Glee fandom, reminding everyone of the complex relationships and rich lore that captivated audiences for years.

The video serves as a perfect time capsule, transporting fans back to a time when weekly episodes were a cultural event, and online forums buzzed with fan fiction, theories, and debates about the love lives of the New Directions members. The 'Quinnchel' pairing, in particular, was one of the most compelling and deeply explored fan concepts. Fans of the ship argued that the intense, often tumultuous rivalry between the former head cheerleader and the star soprano was a classic example of a "will they or won't they" dynamic. They pointed to moments of vulnerability, grudging respect, and shared ambition between the two characters as evidence of an underlying romantic tension that the show never explicitly addressed. These fan theories, years after the show's finale, continue to thrive on social media platforms like Tumblr, Twitter, and TikTok.

Dianna Agron's reaction in the video provides a fascinating counterpoint to this fan-driven narrative. Her seemingly off-the-cuff response, â€œWhat about Jesse?â€, is a direct nod to the show's established canon. For those who need a refresher, Jesse St. James, played by Jonathan Groff, was a key figure in Rachel's romantic storyline. As the lead male vocalist of rival glee club Vocal Adrenaline, he and Rachel shared a passionate, albeit turbulent, romance that mirrored their competitive spirit. Their relationship was a cornerstone of Rachelâ€™s journey, culminating in a reunion and a seemingly happy ending for the pair in the series finale. By referencing Jesse, Agron brings the conversation back to the on-screen reality of the characters' lives, highlighting the difference between the creative vision of the writers and the imaginative desires of the fan community.

This is what makes the video so impactful. It's not just a simple interview clip; itâ€™s a moment that bridges the gap between actor and audience. It shows that Agron is not only aware of the deep-seated fan culture surrounding Glee, but that she also has a fond, personal perspective on her character's world. Her reaction, full of genuine surprise and humor, is a testament to the lasting impact of the show and its characters. It reminds us that while the show may have ended, the charactersâ€™ legacies and the conversations they inspire are far from over. The video is a must-watch for any Glee enthusiast, offering a delightful glimpse into how the cast members themselves view the ships and stories that have become legendary in the annals of TV fandom. Itâ€™s a perfect blend of nostalgia, humor, and a reminder of the enduring power of fan-created narratives.
